description: For its composition, Ancient Greek μόλυβδος (mólubdos, “lead”) and crystal habit φύλλον (phúllon, “leaf”),  +‎ -ite. Note that the prefix molybdo- +‎ here does NOT denote molybdenum; the element is named after the same Greek root.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A hexagonal-trapezohedral mineral containing hydrogen, lead, magnesium, oxygen, and silicon.
